body_html:
I ran it and it doesn't crash because of the AttributeError. It crashes because it expects user input for the python library path and defaults to providing nothing if the python library path cannot be found nor provided by the user. Right now it is working as intended but the installation can always be made a little smoother.

Here's a quick workaround to find your path manually while I change the script a lil more:

In your virtualenv run:
$ python
>>> from distutils.sysconfig import get_python_lib
>>> print(get_python_lib())

Copy that output and when you run ./configure paste it into the line that says
Please input the desired Python library path to use. Default is []

It crashes because it expects user input for the python library path and defaults to providing nothing if the python library path cannot be found nor provided by the user.  Right now it is working as intended but the installation can always be made a little smoother.

In your virtualenv run:
`$ python`
`>>> from distutils.sysconfig import get_python_lib`
`>>> print(get_python_lib())` 

Copy that output and when you run `./configure` paste it into the line that says
